intro: Diporidium wallichii var. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diporidium, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, distinguishing it from other varieties. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas.
